executive_summary: Pizza restaurants have suffered revenue declines due to growing competition and some economic volatility over the past five years. Still, demand for pizza restaurants, specifically, has persisted, despite and somewhat because of the pandemic. Pizza is a mainstay in many American households, but other restaurants have begun selling it and various at-home options exist (frozen pizza). Further, rising health consciousness among Americans have lowered demand for pizzas. Overall, pizza restaurant revenue has been falling at a CAGR of 2.4% over the past five years and is expected to reach $50.1 billion in 2024 when revenue will increase an estimated 1.4%.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: COVID-19 Slows Growth Before Providing a Boom
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Despite substantial operational difficulties and severe economic uncertainty, at the height of the pandemic in 2020, pizza restaurant revenue only dipped marginally, as consumers swiftly reduced spending in the face of great uncertainty.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Rising Competition Threatens Pizza Makers in Certain Areas
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Rising inflation and unemployment rates reduced demand for food away from home, including pizzas.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A Rise in Operating Expenses Cuts into Profit
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Supply chain difficulties resulted in many pizza makers experiencing a rise in purchase costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Owners Increasingly Seek Measures to Reduce Wage Costs
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Though purchases represent the highest operational cost for pizza restaurants, wages are close behind, accounting for nearly one-third of the average shop's revenue.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: DEMAND WILL REMAIN BUT GROWTH WILL SLOW
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Pizza's affordability will likely continue insulating it from severe economic shifts.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: HEALTH-CONSCIOUS CONSUMERS WILL BECOME MORE PREVALENT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rising health consciousness among consumers will result in an easing in demand for traditional pizza.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Rising Wage Costs Will Offset Falling Input Prices,
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Resulting in Low, Stagnating Profit Pizza restaurants have historically experienced slim returns.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Restaurants Will Struggle to Establish New Markets
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: While a growing population will provide opportunities, few truly new, substantial markets are likely to emerge.

industry_definition: This industry is composed of operators that prepare and serve pizza and other related items.
key_trends: Competition is fierce, as opening a new pizza restaurant is fairly inexpensive and demand for pizza is somewhat evergreen.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This demographic generally has less disposable cash to spend on food.
Young adults generally have more disposable income.
Middle-aged Americans are becoming more health conscious.
This segment represents the smallest share of revenue.

products_and_services.product_description: Takeout services are accomplished by a customer ordering their food ahead of time and then picking it up from a restaurant.
Delivery services are when a customer orders ahead of time and the food is delivered to them by the restaurant or a third-party source.
Dining is when customers visit a physical pizza restaurant.

tier_1_suppliers: Soft Drink, Baked Goods & Other Grocery Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: During economic booms, increased disposable income boosts dining out.

business_locations.location_description: This region has the largest number of pizza restaurants.
This region has a large number of pizza restaurants because of its dense urban populations.
This region is home to two iconic pizza styles.
This region has fewer pizza restaurants compared to other regions.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Standardized guidelines for safe food handling.
Requirements mandate calorie and nutritional information on menus.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Navigating complex health and safety regulations.
High initial investments can be daunting for new entrants.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Few barriers to entering the industry.

FAQs.question: How does your company market deals on e-commerce sites, such as Groupon, to generate new customers?
FAQs.answer: Promotional offerings and exposure can increase brand loyalty.
